name: 金仕淳
objective:
The objective of the course is to learn how digital image practices in real-world applications, especially in medical images and computer vision.
This class will introduce the image's composition, image adjustment, design, and even feature extraction for radiomics to apply to image detection and recognition. We will train some popular image processing algorithms about image processing and implement them in medical imaging projects.
schedule:
Week 1	Review background - Linear system, linear algebra, and probability.
Week 2	What is Digital Image Processing-Digital Image Fundamentals
Week 3	Intensity Transformations, Spatial Filtering, and kernel function 
Week 4	Fourier properties and Filtering in the Frequency Domain
Week 5	Image Restoration - Recovery
Week 6	Image Reconstruction
Week 7	Morphological Image Processing
Week 8	Intensity-Based Segmentation
Week 9	Midterm
Week 10	Shape based Image Segmentation
Week 11	Pattern Recognition and Description
Week 12	Feature selection and Classifying
Week 13	Medical Image format and processing
Week 14	Radiomics in medical image and information
Week 15	Final Project report (1)
Week 16	Final Project report (2)
Week 17	Final Project report (3)
Week 18	Final Project report (4)
scorePolicy: (1) Homework 20% (2) Midterm 30% (3) Final Project report 30% (4) Participation 20%
materials:
1. Digital Image Process 4/e Gonzalez & Woods
2. The Image Processing Handbook 5/e John C. Russ
3. Medical Image Reconstruction: A Conceptual Tutorial Gengsheng Lawrence Zeng
4. Digital Image Processing Using MATLAB, 2/e Rafael C. Gonzalez, Richard E. Woods, Steven L. Eddins
